title: graph theory - The best way for obtaining the canonical label of a matroid?
body: For a graph, we can canonical labelings with Nauty or other methods. But for a matroid, I do not find an easy way to labeling. Dillon Mayhewa, Gordon F. Royle introduced the hyperplane graph of a matroid in their paper "Matroids with nine elements", which is the bipartite graph whose vertices are the elements and hyperplanes of the matroid and where a hyperplane-vertex is adjacent to an element-vertex if and only if the hyperplane contains the element. Then we can use Nauty to labelings the bipartite graph. But this method is a bit slow. So I want to know is there any better method for canonical labeling of a matroid? graph-theory algorithms matroid-theory Share Cite Improve this question Follow asked Jul 27, 2020 at 12:10 Xie 51 2 2 bronze badges $\endgroup$ 2 2 $\begingroup$ Depending on how your matroid is given, some other hash might be more suitable.
